Author: moriskarlov
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Copytrack Business Updates from Marcus Schmitt on June 7th:  - Team are finalizing the design & logo this and next week, they will make it public. They are also about to finalize the structure of the application layer.  Next week managers will be in their development center in Portugal & work on the Blockchain related topics.  - Copytrack has no plans for Binance listing in the nearest future.  /   /

Author: moriskarlov
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Copytrack CPY token will be switched to new coin in ~August (maybe August 10). CPY is an ERC20 token and the new coin is based on the CONCENSUM blockchain, which is QTUM-based. It will be a special tool for the swap of the tokens. Team will e-Mail every investor and also provide a link on their new web-site. You will send the CPY and get the new tokens in return.  If you are not initial investor, i guess nobody will inform you, so read project official channels.

Author: FollowSynergy
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Something on the topic.  The registration of images on the register will remain free, but we will also offer some external services such as reverse image search or some extended certifications. As long as the Copytrack Enforcement is concerned, we will use CPY as a mean of payment in order to lower the bank transfer fees. In both systems, the Global Copyright Register and the Copytrack Enforcement, you will be able to pay with CPY but also with bank transfer, credit card and Paypal, so you are not forced to use CPY.    Copytrack have recently opened new office in Lisbon, where 4 to 5 developers are sitting full time to develop Global Copyright Register.

Author: sv.alyona
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Photochain’s Partners. Who are they and why are they important for us? https://medium.com/photochain/photochains-partners-who-are-they-and-why-are-they-important-for-us-69f0b9b60119  For a business to be a success, they must recognize the strength of other businesses and collaborate towards each common goal. At Photochain, we understand the need for this, and our approach has always included partners.  To give you a better understanding of our partners and why we work with them, we’ve outlined the key rationale behind each partnership.    At the core of Copytrack is the creation of a global decentralized copyright register for digital content, which authenticates users and links digital intellectual property. This registry will generate a unique ecosystem for rights-holders, thereby providing new e-client marketplaces. With its cutting edge technology and processes, it is well-suited to globally address the key challenges in the industry and will be open to the public.  In an extremely short time frame, Copytrack has grown to become the leading company in the worldwide market of highly automated copyright enforcement. Starting in Berlin and having a presence in New York and Tokyo has allowed Copytrack to directly engage with artists and their networks all over the world.  This mission correlates to Photochain’s goal to create a decentralized copyright chain for the protection of image rights of photography on the Photochain, new generation photography monetization, platform.  As both companies aim at creating a fair exchange of images, whilst ensuring copyright protection between image providers and users worldwide, it is a perfect fit partnership.

Author: ivanpoldark
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Fresh Updates from Copytrack team:👂   "In February, Copytrack Global Copyright Register’s management team visited our development center in Portugal. We topped up our development team & will double the capacity. Also, our management team visited several strategic partners in Japan.  In the beginning of March, Copytrack Global Copyright Register’s Management and Marketing teams had a long meeting about brand communication. Several branding strategies were discussed and we also received useful advices regarding the launch of Global Copyright Register!  We are currently busy to update our webpage including a blog. The development of the Global Copyright Register is in progress until mid 2018 and will be followed by a Token Swap. We want to emphasise that CPY is an utility token, which means that the value of CPY is expected to increase as soon as it is used at our platform. Please refer to the Roadmap: https://copytrack.io/#section-roadmap  Also, we confirmed that there will be master nodes for CPY tokens and we expect that will start before May."  So the project definitely is under development, i hope team managers will be back into bitcointalk, as a part of their community and investors are being here.

Author: silvestar
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Actually the project is good but I couldn’t find detailed information about the team and advisors. Actually I found, it is there but I couldn’t find information about who they are, what they are doing. Furthermore, the addition of the binance is for increasing the interest to the project.  I think that the project will collect the amount that it wants after that binance. But, the binance event doesn’t looks like good. I mean to saying that we have started to interviews hangs in the air. From my side, I think that it has my interest and my confidence. Can it enter to binance or can’t it, I can’t say it. But Binance’s CEO had a topic on this subject. I guess I saw it in a paper on how to enter the binance. As far as I remember, he said something like that “even if there really is a deal with Binance, the leak of this information to someone else's premises can lead to the cancellation of the introduction of the progeny and a very advanced process.”  Absolutely to not saying it is the first rule. After the necessary conditions etc are evaluated, binance is already take or do not take, on its own way. But only making application and then saying that we are discussing and putting it to the website, moreover doing it during the ico process is interesting for me.

Body: Interview with Marcus Schmitt, CEO of Copytrack https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rb2aBqeskgU  CopyTrack is going ALL IN on blockchain technology to provide copyright protection and enforcement solutions that supercede anything available today. CopyTrack has established themselves as the market leader in automated copyright enforcement and their current user base spans across 140 countries. By the looks of it, they're positioned to drastically alter the way businesses, artists, publishers, and individuals are able to handle and enforce the digital rights to their content. The Global CopyTrack register will be launched Q2 of 2018 and CPY token holders will be able to stake their tokens, as Proof of Stake will be used for the consensus model of CopyTrack.

Author: Shinryuu0
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: I wonder why it's so calm about this project too. They already have an existing business and want to get everything on the blockchain with a real use of their tokens.  The things that make me unsure right now ist the fact, that you can just whitelist with your name and ETH address. No KYC needed. No serious ICO does that anymore. And why did they advertise with HitBTC, Tdax and a Binance application? Other ICOs say, they aren't allowed to talk about exchanges before token sales end.  Should this be a red flag? I hope someone can explain that before I decide to invest.

Author: CopytrackHQ
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: WEBSITE - WHITEPAPER - TWITTER - TELEGRAM - STEEMIT  Copytrack revolutionizes how creators protect, track and monetize their work by using blockchain and smart contracts technology.  Copytrack is the undisputed market leader in uncovering image theft with headquarters in Berlin and Singapore, and subsidiaries in New York and Tokyo. With our upcoming ICO we set the precedent for a global, transparent and decentralized register for copyrights of digital content.  PRE-SALE NOW LIVE: DECEMBER 10 TO JAN 10 https://copytrack.io BUSINESS WHITEPAPER https://copytrack.io/pdf/Copytrack_ICO_Whitepaper.pdf TECHNICAL WHITEPAPER https://copytrack.io/pdf/Copytrack_ICO_Technical_Whitepaper.pdf BOUNTY PROGRAM TBA  TOKEN SALE INFO: Copytrack’s token pre-sale is open now and will be followed by the crowd sale on Jan 10th, 2018. Minimum: 0.1 ETH. Maximum: 2,500 ETH   Copytrack Vision & Market Overview  Whilst the digital image market is growing exponentially with more than 2 billion images uploaded every day, up to 85% of images online are used without a valid license. Photographers suffer an enormous financial loss and are often unaware that their images are being copied and distributed elsewhere.  On the other end of the spectrum, the image licensing market is controlled by only a few players that keep up to 70% of revenue to themselves. Copytrack is here to change that.  By introducing a distributed database for images, we are moving image copyright registration, licensing and payments to the blockchain. This will reshape how photographers and creators protect, track and monetize their work in the following ways:  1. No more image theft By registering images directly on the blockchain, all their usage and distribution will be registered. Creators are automatically notified whenever an image is being used.  2. Global copyright database The open and global database of rights-holders and their work allows users to easily license and track their creative work.  3. Fair & transparent compensation The CPY token directly connects creators and clients and facilitates transactions via smart contracts. Creatives are in full control of their own pricing and licensing options without any intermediaries, who nowadays take cuts of up to 70%.   Questions? Join us on Telegram: https://t.me/copytrackhq/  About Copytrack  Copytrack is the undisputed market leader in uncovering image theft with headquarters in Berlin and Singapore and subsidiaries in New York and Tokyo. Over the past three years we have helped the photography community to claim image rights in over 50.000 of unsolicited use cases.  With the Copytrack Global Copyright Register, we are taking digital copyright registration to the next level. It is our goal is to provide a solution for the key challenges of digital content copyright as they still exist today:  How to proof digital content authorship globally? How to track illegal use globally? How to license digital content globally?  Core Documents  Copytrack WHITEPAPER: 3https://ico.copytrack.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Copytrack_ICO_Whitepaper.pdf Copytrack Technical Paper: https://ico.copytrack.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Technical_Whitepaper_Copytrack_ICO.pdf Copytrack Video: https://vimeo.com/243861270  Token Economics & Structure    Roadmap    Team    MARCUS SCHMITT (CEO) Marcus is a serial entrepreneur and executive manager with more than 20 years of experience in founding, scaling and management of startups, SMEs and enterprises. Previous to Copytrack, he scaled the business of “Flightright” as CEO, now leading the market of legal enforcement of claims arising from flight delays and cancellations. Marcus spent three years as Vice President for the EU market at an international consultancy, and many years as a consultant for internationalization. https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcusmschmitt/  STEFAN BAER (CTO) More than 15 years of professional experience as an IT expert & manager of software development. Stefan studied IT-systems engineering at Hasso-Plattner-Institute (HPI) and Information Technology at University of Potsdam. In 2009, Stefan founded PIXRAY GmbH (competitor) based on his research and master thesis in the area of image recognition. He is responsible for research & technology development, IT infrastructure and services. https://www.linkedin.com/in/baerstefan    SANDRO MAEDER (COO) Experienced operations and project manager with international background. Studied economic science at HTW University in Berlin, Germany. Before his current role at Copytrack, Sandro worked as the Operations Manager at VJSUAL, a company producing digital explainer videos, interactive videos and screen casts. https://www.linkedin.com/in/sandro-m%C3%A4der-6b074b152  MARIE SLOWIOCZEK-MANNSFELD (Global Head of Legal) Experienced lawyer with a focus on intellectual property and copyright law. Studied law in Berlin, Germany, and Dublin, Ireland and Prague, Czech Republic. Prior to joining Copytrack, Marie worked several years as a lawyer at Haerting Lawyers in Berlin, specializing in IP, Copyright and IT law. https://www.linkedin.com/in/marie-slowioczek-mannsfeld-abb7537a  Advisors    DANIEL EIBA (Advisor Business Model, Marketing & Sales) Daniel is a business and operations executive with more than 14 years of experience in developing products, driving growth and monetization in digital content. He served in several leadership roles at Yahoo!, Flickr, Table.co and Uniplaces. As a former Director of Flickr, he knows the nuances of the picture business. https://www.linkedin.com/in/danieleiba  SEBASTIAN MANNSFELD (Advisor Intl. Finance & Tax) Sebastian is a global business operations manager holding 15 years of combined Finance and IT experience. He served in several roles at PricewaterhouseCoopers, Bearing Point, Gazprom and General Electric where he acquired his wide international taxation, accounting and  financing knowledge. https://www.linkedin.com/in/sebastian-mannsfeld-00831215/    SASCHA SCHUMANN (Advisor IT-Security) Sascha is CEO of Germany’s Myra Security, helping governments and global E-Commerce companies to protect themselves against permanent online threats. He is a member of the PHP Group which oversees the well-being of the OpenSource language PHP. https://www.linkedin.com/in/sascha-schumann-41792a5b  NORIAKI OKUBO (Advisor Investments & Investor) Noriaki has been in the technology sector for the past 15 years. He is currently Managing partner at Scentan Ventures, which is a venture capital  rm focused on technology. He also serves as a board member for several companies including Tradeshift, where he leads the 75.000.000 USD Series C Round. https://www.linkedin.com/in/noriaki-okubo-5494654/    KEN SHISHIDO (Advisor Cryptocurrency) Ken is one of Japan’s most famous Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Advocates. He is Co-Organizer of the Bitcoin Tokyo Meetup Group, which was founded by Roger Ver. Ken serves as an Advisor to many crypto startups and frequently speaks at crypto meetups and events. Ken is a Libertarian and believes in liberty and free market competition. https://www.linkedin.com/in/ken-shishido-419690a2/  AARON KOENIG (Advisor Cryptocurrency) Aaron is an entrepreneur, consultant and writer specialising in BTC and Blockchain. He has been promoting Bitcoin and Blockchain technology since 2011 by writing and by organizing events and meetups. He has also been a speaker and panelist at numerous conferences. He is the bestselling author of the books A Beginner’s Guide to Bitcoin and Investing in Digital Currencies. https://www.linkedin.com/in/aaron-koenig-6277781/  Presale and Crowdsale  Pre-sale registration is now live: December 10 to Jan 10: https://ico.copytrack.com The minimum contribution amount is 0.1 ETH and the maximum contribution is 2,500 ETH.  We are launching a full TOKEN SALE to distribute the majority of the Copytrack tokens. The date of the token sale is aimed for Jan 10th, 2018 ONLY ETHER (ETH) IS ACCEPTED.  NOTE: These tokens are strictly for use on the Copytrack Blockchain. They have no other intended uses.  Please note that this sale is not open to US citizens and residents, except accredited investors.  Ask us Anything  If you’d like to learn more about Copytrack please find us at the following channels:  Telegram: https://t.me/copytrackhq/ SteemIt Blog: https://steemit.com/@copytrackhq Twitter: https://twitter.com/copytrackhq    WEBSITE - WHITEPAPER - TWITTER - TELEGRAM - STEEMIT

Author: JanEmil
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Don't work. Very very hard to find images because if you resize or edit in any way the hash value change. When you save for web all exif data on images are deleted. The best way to find stolen images is https://images.google.com. They use advanced image recognition trained with AI. When you find stolen images the problem is to get payment. Most images are used on privat profiles. But the problem are real. Points for trying.

Author: CopytrackHQ
Title: [ANN] [ICO] Copytrack: The First Blockchain-Based Image Copyright Register
Body: Official statement on KodakOne  Many of you asked us about the latest news on Kodak's planned ICO. Here's the statement of our CEO, Marcus Schmitt:  “It’s always been our mission to improve the protection of photographers and rightsholders online. It’s been a great recognition to be supported by over 1600 backers who have invested a total of $ 7.6 million USD in our vision to democratize copyright and prevent image theft for photographers – and this was just the pre-sale.  Unlike Copytrack, KodakOne is still in the preparation stage. We can only state 3 key differences and facts between KodakOne’s planned ICO and Copytrack’s Global Copyright Register so far:  KodakOne is a brand licensing cooperation between Kodak and Wenn Digital Inc., a Delaware company founded in Nov.2017. Copytrack has a proven track record of several years and has developed its technology fully in-house with enforcement services in 140 countries. KodakOne plans to solely register images on the blockchain while Copytrack’s “Global Copyright Register” is an open blockchain for any type of digital content (images, music, video, etc.). KodakOne’s ICO will be a closed sale that’s only accessible to accredited investors, whereas Copytrack keeps its ICO open to all investors of the blockchain and cryptocurrency community  We can’t comment on KodakOne’s technology as neither their system nor their whitepaper are available yet.  At Copytrack we strongly believe that blockchain and cryptocurrencies set the foundation of the internet’s future. It’s exciting to be part of it and help creators protect, track and monetize their work with the Global Copyright Register. Our main sale ICO still runs until February 10”, concludes Schmitt.  Learn more about the CopytrackICO on https://copytrack.io/
